Recommendations for Firms
Use a firewall within the firm, with elements including:
Exercise substantial control of relevant interdepartmental communications through a
clearance area, such as the compliance or legal department.
Review employee trades.
Maintain “watch,” “restricted,” and “rumor” lists.
Monitor and restrict proprietary trading while a firm is in possession of material
nonpublic information. However, prohibiting all proprietary trading while a firm is
in possession of material nonpublic information may be inappropriate because it may
send a signal to the market. In these cases, firms should only take the opposite side of
unsolicited customer trades.
